Giada. Italy. 22. House Stark.

Multifandom and so much more.

tags: i’m so pissed when i see this kind of dumbness
summary: Michelle Clapton, costume designer for GOT: “I didn’t want Arya to wear the big pelts that Jon, Sansa and Bran have. I didn’t...
body:
Michelle Clapton, costume designer for GOT: “I didn’t want Arya to wear the big pelts that Jon, Sansa and Bran have. I didn’t want her to look too much of a Stark, because she really isn’t anymore. Sansa in her costume almost represents Winterfell, but Arya looks as if she’s passing through. Whether or not that’s the case, we’ll have to see.”

Oh, my bad, so I just completely imagined all the storyline of her past seasons? The struggle to regain her identity? How she left the faceless man because she realized she couldn’t let go of who she was? Guess “A girl is Arya Stark of Winterfell, and I’m going home” was an uditive hallucination.

I probably made up a lot of other things too then, like Arya crying when she had to hide Needle, or when she had to pretend Jon wasn’t her brother, or her reaction when she finally returned to Winterfell and that background music; her expression when Hot Pie told her Jon was alive; how she dropped her revenge as soon as she knew she could go back home. How now she’s gonna fight for that same home and for her family and the people she loves; her voice when she talked with Sansa about how much she missed her father; her smiles, the ones reserved only for her siblings, each time she finally reunited with them? Yep, guess I made all that up uh?

P.S. And of course Bran, bless him, who is an emotionless shell now, not even the shadow of the little lively boy that Brandon Stark was, is more of a Stark than Arya?

Michelle, honestly? Are you sure you’ve watched your own show?

How now she’s gonna fight for that same home and for her family and the people she loves; her voice when she talked with Sansa about how much she missed her father; her smiles, the ones reserved only for her siblings, each time she finally reunited with them? Michelle, honestly? Are you sure you’ve watched your own show?

summary: New Gendrya Fanfic I’m Writing
title: New Gendrya Fanfic I’m Writing
body:

Summary: Only child Arya, grows up in the foster system, goes to Uni and finds her childhood friend, Gendry is a professor at her Uni, and let’s just say they’ve both grown up a lot.

summary: I just read a theory that Arya was killed in her battle with the Waif, and it's been the Waif walking around with an Arya face...
body:
I just read a theory that Arya was killed in her battle with the Waif, and it’s been the Waif walking around with an Arya face this whole time.

QUICK, someone explain to me why this definitely cannot at all be the case before my heart breaks.

summary: april 26th — when i told you to “change”, i didn’t mean for you to leave me behind
body:
april 26th — when i told you to “change”, i didn’t mean for you to leave me behind

characters: sandor clegane, sansa stark, arya stark

relationship: sandor clegane/sansa stark

warnings: n/a (minor use of vulgar language)

notes: an au that shows the reunion between sansa and sandor, set in between episode 1 and 2 of season 8.

Sansa waited for the past three days for the scar-faced man to make eye contact with her. All she wanted was for him to notice her, as after all those years they had been separated, both of them were still alive.

When the Stark girl went to bed, taking comfort wrapped in the arms of her sister, she told her about the Hound’s distance. “I saw him in the forge when I went to visit Gendry. He told me I was a cold little bitch.”

“That sounds like him.” Sansa still couldn’t believe it was him who Arya journeyed with. “I don’t know why he’s been avoiding me.”

“Perhaps he doesn’t know what to say,” Arya offered. “What did you last talk about?”

Sansa knew immediately. “He offered to take me with him. Away from King’s Landing.”

“And you denied?”

She nodded. Arya’s arms fell off of Sansa’s shoulders and suddenly she felt cold. “Well that’s why. He’s probably embarrassed. I can go speak to him-“

“No!” she blurted. “Arya, if he feels that way, I should go and talk to him myself. That way I can apologize.”

Arya’s brow creased. “Why would you apologize?”

Her sister was right. Why was she going to apologize? Sansa shouldn’t have been sorry for letting him down… but I am.

Instead of responding, she wrapped her arms around Arya’s back, knotted and tight from the perils she had gone through for years. Sansa used to sleep with all of her siblings, but it seemed Arya was the only one left (she didn’t count Bran, because he claimed to be “above sleep” as the Three-Eyed Raven).

“Don’t tell him you’re sorry,” Arya breathed into her ear, both of their eyes closing as they readied themselves to dream. “He’ll mock you, and I don’t want to kill someone you seem to like.”

***

Sansa awoke to her sister’s body fully entangled in her own. Growing up in Winterfell, Sansa always had to curl up with one of her siblings to sleep. Robb was her go-to, since he was bigger and older than her. Then it was Arya, and the two of them normally disbanded their daily-feuds to sleep together. Bran was after, and Sansa had to admit he was her favorite. At least, he was before. Finally it was little Rickon, although she wished she had gotten to see him more before his death.

To get out from the mess of limbs, Sansa had to wriggle through hands and feet. Of course, she tried not to wake Arya, but instead she managed to fall off the bed when she finally freed herself, and the noise immediately made her sister’s eyes open.

“You’re going?” Arya groaned, still tired.

“I have to.” Sansa didn’t bother changing out of her nightgown and proceeded out of her chambers.

She was lucky enough to have found him sitting against a wall outside, displaying the vast environment around Winterfell. “Ser.”

His head moved slightly to face her. “I’m not a knight, little bird. You should know that.” His eyes examined her face. “You survived.”

“I did.”

The Hound turned his head away, taking a swing at his drink. “You also changed quite a bit, little bird.”

“You did as well.” Sansa took a step closer. “I told you to change when we were in King’s Landing. You were mean, cruel-“

Sandor laughed. “Aye, that I was.”

Sansa’s eyebrows creased. “When I told you to “change”, I didn’t mean for you to leave me behind.”

His gaze flicked to hers. “What?”

“When you arrived at Winterfell with Daenerys and Jon, you avoided me. I tried to find you, to talk to you, but you kept walking away. Gods! It was like walking in circles, and then I’d get lost and reconcile with someone along the way and forget all about my quest in search of you.”

Without a word, Sandor handed her the drink. He thought she seemed frustrated, and drinking was the only thing that made his problems go away. That and killing people.

Sansa grabbed it with little hesitation, tilting her head back and letting the liquid pour down her throat. She didn’t realize how strong it tasted, and when her head moved down she broke into a fit of coughs. Sandor forced out a rumbling laugh, and following soon was Sansa’s own giggles.

“You know,” he started. “Your sister never used to shut up about you when we traveled together. She complained about you and Joffrey.”

“You heard she had a kill list, right?” Sansa looked over. “Was I ever on it?”

Sandor frowned. “No, you weren’t.” Looking past the wall, he continued. “I was, once.”

“You were?” Her voice rose in interest. “What did you do?”

“Lots of things.” The Hound trailed off. “I didn’t leave you behind when I changed. I thought about what a stupid fucking man I was as the King’s bodyguard. I took care of Arya, partly because I wanted money, but also because I felt I let you down. I should have taken you with me.”

“I didn’t want to go,” Sansa said. “It wasn’t your fault.”

He sighed. “I felt guilty, going to speak with you. You’re much less of a little bird now than before.”

“We’ve both changed,” she restated.

“Aye.” Sandor tipped his head back and sent the alcohol down his throat. The only good thing about staying in Winterfell was seeing the Stark girls again and drinking.

————————

tagging: @downwithwritersblock, @passion-of-the-stark

“When you arrived at Winterfell with Daenerys and Jon, you avoided me. I tried to find you, to talk to you, but you kept walking away. Gods! It was like walking in circles, and then I’d get lost and reconcile with someone along the way and forget all about my quest in search of you.”

Without a word, Sandor handed her the drink. He thought she seemed frustrated, and drinking was the only thing that made his problems go away. That and killing people.

Sansa grabbed it with little hesitation, tilting her head back and letting the liquid pour down her throat. She didn’t realize how strong it tasted, and when her head moved down she broke into a fit of coughs. Sandor forced out a rumbling laugh, and following soon was Sansa’s own giggles.

“You know,” he started. “Your sister never used to shut up about you when we traveled together. She complained about you and Joffrey.”

“You heard she had a kill list, right?” Sansa looked over. “Was I ever on it?”

Sandor frowned. “No, you weren’t.” Looking past the wall, he continued. “I was, once.”

“You were?” Her voice rose in interest. “What did you do?”

“Lots of things.” The Hound trailed off. “I didn’t leave you behind when I changed. I thought about what a stupid fucking man I was as the King’s bodyguard. I took care of Arya, partly because I wanted money, but also because I felt I let you down. I should have taken you with me.”

“I didn’t want to go,” Sansa said. “It wasn’t your fault.”

He sighed. “I felt guilty, going to speak with you. You’re much less of a little bird now than before.”

“We’ve both changed,” she restated.

“Aye.” Sandor tipped his head back and sent the alcohol down his throat. The only good thing about staying in Winterfell was seeing the Stark girls again and drinking.

————————

tagging: @downwithwritersblock, @passion-of-the-stark
trail.content:
april 26th — when i told you to “change”, i didn’t mean for you to leave me behind

characters: sandor clegane, sansa stark, arya stark

relationship: sandor clegane/sansa stark

warnings: n/a (minor use of vulgar language)

notes: an au that shows the reunion between sansa and sandor, set in between episode 1 and 2 of season 8.

Sansa waited for the past three days for the scar-faced man to make eye contact with her. All she wanted was for him to notice her, as after all those years they had been separated, both of them were still alive.

When the Stark girl went to bed, taking comfort wrapped in the arms of her sister, she told her about the Hound’s distance. “I saw him in the forge when I went to visit Gendry. He told me I was a cold little bitch.”

“That sounds like him.” Sansa still couldn’t believe it was him who Arya journeyed with. “I don’t know why he’s been avoiding me.”

“Perhaps he doesn’t know what to say,” Arya offered. “What did you last talk about?”

Sansa knew immediately. “He offered to take me with him. Away from King’s Landing.”

“And you denied?”

She nodded. Arya’s arms fell off of Sansa’s shoulders and suddenly she felt cold. “Well that’s why. He’s probably embarrassed. I can go speak to him-“

“No!” she blurted. “Arya, if he feels that way, I should go and talk to him myself. That way I can apologize.”

Arya’s brow creased. “Why would you apologize?”

Her sister was right. Why was she going to apologize? Sansa shouldn’t have been sorry for letting him down… but I am.

Instead of responding, she wrapped her arms around Arya’s back, knotted and tight from the perils she had gone through for years. Sansa used to sleep with all of her siblings, but it seemed Arya was the only one left (she didn’t count Bran, because he claimed to be “above sleep” as the Three-Eyed Raven).

“Don’t tell him you’re sorry,” Arya breathed into her ear, both of their eyes closing as they readied themselves to dream. “He’ll mock you, and I don’t want to kill someone you seem to like.”

***

Sansa awoke to her sister’s body fully entangled in her own. Growing up in Winterfell, Sansa always had to curl up with one of her siblings to sleep. Robb was her go-to, since he was bigger and older than her. Then it was Arya, and the two of them normally disbanded their daily-feuds to sleep together. Bran was after, and Sansa had to admit he was her favorite. At least, he was before. Finally it was little Rickon, although she wished she had gotten to see him more before his death.

To get out from the mess of limbs, Sansa had to wriggle through hands and feet. Of course, she tried not to wake Arya, but instead she managed to fall off the bed when she finally freed herself, and the noise immediately made her sister’s eyes open.

“You’re going?” Arya groaned, still tired.

“I have to.” Sansa didn’t bother changing out of her nightgown and proceeded out of her chambers.

She was lucky enough to have found him sitting against a wall outside, displaying the vast environment around Winterfell. “Ser.”

His head moved slightly to face her. “I’m not a knight, little bird. You should know that.” His eyes examined her face. “You survived.”

“I did.”

The Hound turned his head away, taking a swing at his drink. “You also changed quite a bit, little bird.”

“You did as well.” Sansa took a step closer. “I told you to change when we were in King’s Landing. You were mean, cruel-“

Sandor laughed. “Aye, that I was.”

Sansa’s eyebrows creased. “When I told you to “change”, I didn’t mean for you to leave me behind.”

His gaze flicked to hers. “What?”

“When you arrived at Winterfell with Daenerys and Jon, you avoided me. I tried to find you, to talk to you, but you kept walking away. Gods! It was like walking in circles, and then I’d get lost and reconcile with someone along the way and forget all about my quest in search of you.”

Without a word, Sandor handed her the drink. He thought she seemed frustrated, and drinking was the only thing that made his problems go away. That and killing people.

Sansa grabbed it with little hesitation, tilting her head back and letting the liquid pour down her throat. She didn’t realize how strong it tasted, and when her head moved down she broke into a fit of coughs. Sandor forced out a rumbling laugh, and following soon was Sansa’s own giggles.

“You know,” he started. “Your sister never used to shut up about you when we traveled together. She complained about you and Joffrey.”

“You heard she had a kill list, right?” Sansa looked over. “Was I ever on it?”

Sandor frowned. “No, you weren’t.” Looking past the wall, he continued. “I was, once.”

“You were?” Her voice rose in interest. “What did you do?”

“Lots of things.” The Hound trailed off. “I didn’t leave you behind when I changed. I thought about what a stupid fucking man I was as the King’s bodyguard. I took care of Arya, partly because I wanted money, but also because I felt I let you down. I should have taken you with me.”

“I didn’t want to go,” Sansa said. “It wasn’t your fault.”

He sighed. “I felt guilty, going to speak with you. You’re much less of a little bird now than before.”

“We’ve both changed,” she restated.

“Aye.” Sandor tipped his head back and sent the alcohol down his throat. The only good thing about staying in Winterfell was seeing the Stark girls again and drinking.

————————

blog.title: There are worlds where the sky is burning

summary:
We never stood a chance
(I don't think D**** will refuse to fight, but. I think Jon told her because he felt guilty and above...
body:
We never stood a chance

(I don’t think D**** will refuse to fight, but. I think Jon told her because he felt guilty and above all because he wanted to give her a choice. To remain and fight for her own reasons and not only his. He found out she’s family too and he wants to act accordly. Another missing moment before the battle.)

*

Outside the crypts, in stark contrast to the silence that he has just left behind, the night is a swarm of men in turmoil, a constellation of braziers and campfires that flare up like fallen stars, shouts and orders given over the noise of wind.

As soon as she can, Daenerys slips away, distancing herself from him as much as possible, shortly becoming a shadow among other shadows.

For a moment he is tempted to follow her, then the horns ring again. In his suddenly white and emptied mind, he has no doubt what to do, where to go. He runs towards the battlements and his hopes are not disappointed.

They are both there and at the sound of footsteps, they turn simultaneously to look at him. They appear surprised, like they hadn’t expected to see him.

Sansa is the first to notice that something is wrong. She frowns, her eyes dancing on his face with something akin to a vigilant and cautious concern. “Where’s Daenerys?”

Arya doesn’t make a sound, but in his head he can hear a sharp voice similar to hers distinctly shouting that - we need her dragons!

He could lie, reassure them. He tilts his head a little and forces himself not to take his eyes off, bearing the silent reproach in theirs as he says, “She will not come.”

“What do you mean-” Sansa pales. “No. Tell me you didn’t. Of all the idiotic things you could have done!”

“What are you talking about?” Arya inquires.

“He told her.” Sansa’s voice is flat and weary at the same time.

He looks at them and it’s like something finally clicked in his head. Jon confusedly thinks that he should be more surprised, feel something different from this strange and absolute clear-headedness. For a moment, however, everything becomes obvious, transparent. There’s a clarity to his thinking that’s… frightening.

The truth looks at him from two pairs of eyes, unlike as sun and moon. And he loves them both, but in a different way and oh, so that’s the way things are.

“Why now? Why didn’t you wait after the battle?” Sansa doesn’t accuse him and there is a part of him that is grateful to her while another would prefer her to shout at him.

Because there may not be an after. Because it could be the last chance to say it. Because he foolishly decided to do the good, honorable and right thing. Because he is just like Father. Only he isn’t Ned Stark son, not really. Because when he discovered that Daenerys was also his family, he couldn’t keep lying to her.

“It had to be done.”

There is no need to say anything else.

“You’re an idiot,” she says and for the first time he hears what she’s not saying, but that has always been there between them, in the space that separates them, in the tension that unites them. I love you.

He smiles without smiling. “I know.”

“So what do we do now?” Arya intervenes. She doesn’t make judgments or comment on what she has just witnessed.

“We fight,” he answers without hesitation.

Arya nods, wolfish and serious. She seems hardened in iron and in the blood of a thousand battles. When she disappears, Jon wonders what truly happened to his little sister. He knows the answer. She’s dead. The girl was killed to let the woman be born, the warrior.

“You have to talk to her,” Sansa says earnestly.

“I already did. She doesn’t want to listen to me.”

Out of the corner of his eye, he sees her stiffen. “Then try again and make sure she listen to you this time.”

“You don’t understand.” He wouldn’t want to, but it’s stronger than him. Anger begins to crackle under his skin. “She thinks I want that damned throne.”

“Then convince her that’s not the case!”

“Do you think I didn’t try? You weren’t there. You didn’t see how she looked at me. Like I -” I had betrayed her.

“You’re right, I don’t know, but I can imagine it. I don’t know what it feels like to find out you have a family when you thought you were alone, but I know what it’s like when you lose it and when you get it back. In other circumstances, I would advise you to give her time. Time that we don’t have.” Sansa puts both hands against the merlons and looks down. “Without her, we don’t stand a chance,” she whispers fiercily.

The horns silence whatever he is about to say. “What did you feel?”

Sansa turns around. She’s relaxed, alert, ready for duty. Her profile is cut against the depth of the black sky. There are no stars, too much smoke to see them. It’s a pity. “When you found out. What did you feel?”

Sansa doesn’t flinch, doesn’t breathe. Then mildly, quietly, like she’s confiding a secret, she licks her lips and answers, “Relief.”

Truly, they never stood a chance.

“Then convince her that’s not the case!”

“Do you think I didn’t try? You weren’t there. You didn’t see how she looked at me. Like I -” I had betrayed her.

The horns silence whatever he is about to say. “What did you feel?”

Sansa turns around. She’s relaxed, alert, ready for duty. Her profile is cut against the depth of the black sky. There are no stars, too much smoke to see them. It’s a pity. “When you found out. What did you feel?”

Sansa doesn’t flinch, doesn’t breathe. Then mildly, quietly, like she’s confiding a secret, she licks her lips and answers, “Relief.”

Truly, they never stood a chance.

summary:
And the cold sky 
will write us a song,
But will we ever confess
what we’ve done?
Guess we’re still kids
on the run.

blog.title: sin verguenza
blog.description: Debbie. OG Arya Stark Stan. Been about that Gendrya life since 2012. Ao3: thesunflowermachine. I like memes. Reconsider trying me.

summary:
Just some takes made on my end in dms with Annalesa.
—Lol you know my head starts doing the diagrams I’d do when I was in...
body:
Just some takes made on my end in dms with Annalesa.

—Lol you know my head starts doing the diagrams I’d do when I was in college trying to extrapolate themes and interpretations in order to come to a conclusion but with s7 being so much of a clusterfuck it’s tricky.

—It makes sense to me but yeah we never know

—Like Aryas always felt alone and in some ways, wf is home but not quite a place where she can find the true companionship and acceptance she’s always longed for

—And there comes gendry who loves her as she is, like Needle plays when he sees her. He does not find himself drawn to an idealized Arya but rather what the mysterious and fascinating person she appears to be. He gives her a home, the human connection she always wanted in the true depths of her being. She used to think Jon would give her that when she was little but her brother became a man she can’t wholly relate or share with and he has trouble accepting Arya and her trauma. He could want to reach out to her but it’s not easy.

summary: Top 10 of sisterly relationships because why the heck not?!
body:
Top 10 of sisterly relationships because why the heck not?!

10. Juvia Lockser & Lucy Heartfilia- (Fairy Tail)

9. Anne Shirley-Cuthbert & Diana Barry- (Anne with an E)

8. Jessica Jones & Patricia Walker- (Jessica Jones)

7. Wanda Maximoff (Scarlet Witch) & Natasha Romanoff (Black Widow)- (MCU)

6. Nebula & Gamora - (MCU)

5. Raven & Koriand’r (Starfire) - (Teen Titans)

4. Missandei & Daenerys Targaryen - (Game of Thrones)

3. Sakura Matou & Rin Tohsaka- (Fate Series)

2. Raven Reyes & Clarke Griffin- (The 100)

1. Arya Stark & Sansa Stark- (Game of Thrones)

summary: Finally realized why the flirting between Gendry and Arya always felt a bit off: the actors are ten years apart in age. So when...
body:
Finally realized why the flirting between Gendry and Arya always felt a bit off: the actors are ten years apart in age. So when Gendry first meets Arya, IRL she was 14 and he was 24. In the books, he’s supposed to be about fourteen while she was a girl of nine; in the TV show, of course, they chose to age up everyone, but for whatever reason that didn’t translate to some of the actors.

(Richard Madden, for instance, who’s supposed to be the same age as Gendry, was also 24 when filming started and was supposedly playing a 17-yo character, as was Kit Harington.

On the plus side: Oona Chaplin, Rose Leslie and Emilia Clarke are the same age as Richard and Kit.)

summary: Sansa & Arya’ Song
title: Sansa & Arya’ Song
body:
WOLF AT YOUR DOOR

[Lead singer of X Ambassadors, Sam Harris] co-wrote the song with the sister duo Chloe x Halle and Reed. He explained, “We didn’t have a song that really encapsulated the spirit of Sansa and Arya’s relationship yet… It’s reflective of where these women have landed in the show. They have both been hardened by war and loss and betrayal — yet still have a moral compass.”

Here is the video

And here my fave parts of the lyrics:

About Arya:

All creeps softly in the snow
Light and tears along a path (‘Long a path)
A knife between her teeth, she roams
For she is now a stranger

About Sansa:

Chasin’ a fairy tale (Fairy tale), chasin’ a lie (Lie)
But everything changes (Changes) and everything dies (Dies)
You preyed on my innocence (Innocence), tried to bury my name (Name)
But now there’s ice in my veins, oh
